title: test_clone.test_reckless fails with -devel annex: .lck remains group writeable
body:
Ran into while testing master against annex https://github.com/datalad/datalad/pull/4915 
https://travis-ci.org/github/datalad/datalad/jobs/725619122 and https://travis-ci.org/github/datalad/datalad/jobs/725619124 and https://travis-ci.org/github/datalad/datalad/jobs/725619118 have following clone fail:

```
======================================================================

----------------------------------------------------------------------

    return t(*(arg + (filename,)), **kw)

AssertionError: 16 is not false
```

Test code is

```python
        # the standard setup keeps the annex locks accessible to the user only
        nok_((ds.pathobj / '.git' / 'annex' / 'index.lck').stat().st_mode \
             & stat.S_IWGRP)
```

so far failed to reproduce locally using 3.6 in conda and with `DATALAD_REPO_VERSION=6` as was in one of those runs. but only on that test:
```
DATALAD_REPO_VERSION=6 python -m nose -s -v datalad/core/distributed/tests/test_clone.py:test_reckless
```
and since not observed before I wonder if that is a regression in annex. Could it relate to umask settings? (cannot reproduce also with umask 022).
